thread.title: Tourism in the Czech Republic
thread.title_full: Tourism in the Czech Republic | MENAFN.COM

author: Arab News
title: Tourism in the Czech Republic
text:
(MENAFN - Arab News) This is in response to the report published in Arab News 'Czech Embassy grapples with large number of visa applications' on Aug.13. 

I am surprised that some facts particularly concerning the Czech Republic's supposed limitation of the number of visas issued to Gulf tourists mentioned in the report in question don't reflect the truth and don't comply with the text on our embassy's website. 

The writer of the story failed to contact relevant officials at the embassy to verify facts. 

Arab guests and tourists are always welcome in the Czech Republic. The number of guests from Gulf countries has been constantly increasing. Our country never planned or plans to reduce the number of visas issued to our guests from the Kingdom any other Gulf country or from any other part of the world. Our tourism and spa industry is dedicated to making guests from all over the world feel comfortable. 

The Czech Republic has a long tradition in tourism and hospitality. And in a bid to further promote tourism the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Czech Republic and the Embassy in Riyadh have substantially increased the number of consular staff and diplomats and extended working hours of the consular section. We plan to open two outsourcing visa offices in Riyadh and Jeddah with the cooperation of Saudi tourist agencies in near future. Vladimir Lukastik Charge d'affaires a.i. Embassy of the Czech Republic Riyadh
